column5: just came across this website http://www.magicmaps.ca while deciding whether or not to drop the money on a map for my new GPS. I have downloaded some and loaded them onto my new GPS and they work great.  Best part is they are FREE
only works for magellan GPS units though according to the site...  not much use for us lowrance guys
uglyfish I believe there is a program out there that you can use to convert those Magellan to Garmin or whatever, I thought I had it but i cant find it right now.
there has got to be some sites around for lowrance. This one saved me $100. Not bad considering I saved almost $200 on the GPS itself.
Theres always http://www.ibycus.com/ibycustopo/ for "older" garmin. Might work for lowrance too, not sure.
Thanks to Dan, I picked up one myself today..But I havent had much luck with that zip file map, might get you to call me dan and walk my incompetent azz thru it........
zip file? Did you look inside the zip? Maybe you have to extract it.
Does anyone know if a magellan sport tac color is considered as a crossover series?
Try using GPS Babel. You get get a free download (use Google) or use GPSvisualizer.com.  it converts the files from one brand to another.
